title: Welcome!
text:
Discord
Go posit.co/conference, click Login. Click image to connect to the posit::conf() Discord server.
This workshop has a private channel under Workshops.

#level-up-shiny

Great place to ask questions, post resources, memes, or most anything else before, during, and after the workshop.

title: Welcome!
text:
RStudio Cloud
You can use the following link to join the workshops RStudio cloud space,

bit.ly/conf2023_shiny_cloud

Once you have joined you can then select the get-started-shiny assignment,
TK Image of assignment
which should then create a copy of all materials and launch a cloud session for you.

title: Level Up with Shiny for R
text: Workshop at posit::conf(2024)August 12, 202409:00 - 17:00ROOM TBA

title: Level Up with Shiny for R
text:
Introduction
Shiny lets you quickly create rich, data-driven web applications for yourself, your clients, your students, or your colleagues. This workshop will give you the skills you need to build complex applications with brilliant user interfaces.
You‚Äôll learn how to make the most of recent developments in the Shiny ecosystem, while mastering techniques for modularizing and structuring your applications for growth and maintainability. Along the way, you‚Äôll encounter new techniques to speed up your applications using caching and databases for a smooth user experience.

title: Level Up with Shiny for R
text:
Setup

üìò Website (you are here!)
üßë‚Äçüíª Join Posit Cloud Space (Only for workshop participants)
üì¶ Repository


Using Posit Cloud






Warning




These instructions will be updated.


I‚Äôve prepared a Posit Cloud workspace for workshop participants with a project for you to use during our time together. The project contains all of the files and packages pre-installed and ready to go. All you need to do is log in and start coding!
If you already have a Posit Cloud account, first join the rmedicine-2024-bslib space on Posit Cloud. Otherwise sign up for a free account and then join the space. You can create an account with your email or login with Google, GitHub or Clever.
Once you‚Äôre part of the rmedicine-2024-bslib space, select the rmedicine-2024-bslib assignment to create and launch a new project just for you.
